Many countries' governments are unstable and often unwilling to switch to renewable energy sources. Countries with high potential for renewable energy projects I have in mind are mostly in Sub-Saharan Africa, since they have lots of sun. Many of those countries have too many political or security burdens, like Nigeria, African Coup Belt, etc. but there are also exceptions like Ivory Coast, Botswana, etc.

Additionally, logistics can be a major issue (transporting all the shit to that country). It would be hard to manufacture all the infrastructure in the countries directly, so it would be necessary to import it from another country.",Neither,"In this case, I believe it would be more fair to choose the project based on the amount of people it would influence positively, negatively. More context about them is needed.",Neither,"Again, more context is needed.",Neither,Higher return often means higher risk. More context is needed to understand how the projects would benefit the country.,Project G,,"Political,Economic","Legal,Political,Economic,Social,Political Stability,Environmental,RE Demand",0,,0,,"Legal,Political,Economic,Social,Environmental","Political Stability,RE Demand"
